greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, a(n) = smallest number not occurring earlier such that the concatenation a(n-1) and a(n) is a prime.
comment: Almost certainly a permutation of A045572. - _David W. Wilson_, Jan 15 2005
link: Paolo P. Lava, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: with(numtheory): P:= proc(q) local a,b,n,v; v:={1}; a:=1; print(a);
while true do for n from 3 to q do b:=a*10^(ilog10(n)+1)+n;
if isprime(b) and v intersect {n}={} then v:=v union {n}; a:=n; print(n); break; fi;
od; od; end: P(10^6); # _Paolo P. Lava_, May 09 2017
mathematica: a = {{1}}; Do[k = 2; While[Nand[! MemberQ[a, #], PrimeQ@ FromDigits@ Join[a[[n - 1]], #]] &@ Set[d, IntegerDigits@ k], k++]; AppendTo[a, d], {n, 2, 61}]; FromDigits /@ a (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 08 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A075607(n,show=0,a=1,u=[])={for(n=2,n,show&&print1(a","); u=setunion(u,[a]); while(#u>1&&u[2]==u[1]+2,u=u[2..-1]); forstep(k=u[1]+2, 9e9, 2, setsearch(u,k)&&next; isprime(eval(Str(a,k))) && (a=k) && break)); a} \\ Use 2nd, 3rd or 4th optional arg to print intermediate terms, to use another starting value or to exclude some terms. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 25 2015
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 28 2002
ext: More terms from _Michel ten Voorde_ Jun 23 2003
